description.narrative: ISA-II is the follow-up phase of ISA-I that ended in December 2016. It started in 2021 aiming to support the Zambezi Valley Development Agency (ZVDA) for inclusive and sustainable agricultural development in the Zambezi Valley as part of a broader package of development support involving various financial partners. The programme is considered relevant in its basic objective and approach to promote market-oriented agriculture, businesses and value chains. It consists of following components: a) Capacity building of the ZVDA to fulfill is mandate of coordinating and facilitating the socioeconomic development in the Zambezi Valley region; b) Capacity building directed at agriculture educational centers and agribusi- ness development service (BDS) providers; c) Services delivery to small farmers and small businesses. In 2018 the ISA-II programme was adjusted to integrate the Water Produc- tivity pilot project that seeks mainly to increase water use efficiency in small- holder agriculture in 4 districts of the Zambezi Valley. It is based on Farmer–led irrigation approach developed by Wageningen University and largely promoted by the World Bank. Through this project, smallholder farmers are building capacities and skills that help them to adapt and mitigate negative impacts of climate change. The current proposed adjustment aims to extend the programme for one year, until December 2022. Due to cyclone Idai in 2019 and the restrictions imposed by COVID-19 in the period 2019-2021, the ISA II programme suf- fered delays in implementation and targets will not be achieved until December 2021, with the exception of the Water Productivity project implementa- tion and targets, also known as APSAN-Vale. In order to recover the delay, both the Mid Term Review carried out in 2020 and the Final Evaluation conducted in 2021 recommended the following: 1. A 1-year no-cost extension for the value chains related component 3-Implementation Projects; 2. A 1-year cost-extension for APSAN-Vale to consolidate its achievements.The APSAN-Vale was integrated in the ISA II programme, with earmarked funding and its implemented by a consortium contracted by the Zambezeency.
